channel.title: Django on Sudeep's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Django on Sudeep's Blog

item.title: URL Shortener with Django (Part 5) - Working with Templates and finishing up
item.description:
Create folder ’templates’ inside ‘shortenersite’ and then inside ’templates’ create folder ‘shortenersite’.

Inside “shortenersite/templates/shortenersite/” create ‘base.html’ and ‘index.html’. So now paste the following to them.

item.title: URL Shortener with Django (Part 4) - Working with Urls and views
item.description:
Now we will be working with our actual URLs and Views of our site.

Open up your “urlshortener/urls.py” and add the following code to it:

[urlshortener/urls.py]

item.title: URL Shortener with Django (Part 3) - Creating django app and model
item.description:
Now, Let us create a Django app. From your project’s root directory run this command

django-admin startapp shortenersite

item.title: URL Shortener with Django (Part 2) - Creating a new django project
item.description:
Creating a Django project

django-admin startproject urlshortener

Now you will see new directory “urlshortener”. Now our folder structure looks something like:

item.title: URL Shortener with Django (Part 1) - Creating virtual environment and installing Django
item.description: IÂ finally got the time to write a Django tutorial. In this tutorial we are building URL Shortener. If you are confused with what we are building then we are building something similar to (bit.ly) or (goo.gl).
